prompt_update: You will receive a text. Your task is to continue this text. Just output your new text, nothing else. Here is the text:
initial_story:
The baby suffered a cardiac arrest at the theme park on Thursday

A woman has been arrested on suspicion of neglecting a five-month-old boy who suffered a cardiac arrest at a theme park.

The baby is in a critical condition in hospital following the incident at Legoland Windsor at about 13:00 BST on Thursday, police said.

A 27-year-old woman from Witham, Essex, was arrested on suspicion of neglecting a child to cause unnecessary injury.

She has been released on bail until 26 July.

Det Con Zoe Eele, of Thames Valley Police's Child Abuse Investigation Unit, said: "Firstly, our thoughts are with the family of the boy who is in a critical condition in hospital after suffering a cardiac arrest.

"We are working closely with the team at Legoland Windsor Resort but would like to speak to anyone who have information about this incident, specifically anyone who was queueing for the Coastguard HQ boat ride between around 11.30am and 12:45pm.

"I would ask for the public to please avoid speculation about the incident and to respect the boy's family at this deeply upsetting time."

Police said they are not looking for further suspects in relation to the incident.

In a statement, the theme park said: "On Thursday, a young guest was taken ill... and our fully trained First Aid team administered immediate care until the emergency services arrived.

"We will continue to support Thames Valley Police with their ongoing investigation."

Follow BBC South on Facebook, X, or Instagram. Send your story ideas to south.newsonline@bbc.co.uk or via WhatsApp on 0808 100 2240.

The BBC is not responsible for the content of external sites.
stories: As the investigation continues, police are reviewing CCTV footage and speaking to witnesses who were at the theme park on Thursday. They are also looking into the baby's medical history and speaking to his family members to piece together the events leading up to the cardiac arrest. Meanwhile, the community is rallying around the family, with a local charity setting up a fundraising page to support them during this difficult time.

The charity, known for its work in supporting families of children with critical illnesses, has already seen an outpouring of donations, with over $10,000 raised in just a few hours. Neighbors and friends of the family have also been leaving flowers and cards outside their home, offering words of comfort and support. The theme park, which has been cooperating fully with the investigation, has also issued a statement expressing its condolences to the family and promising to do everything in its power to prevent such a tragedy from happening again in the future.

The local community has rallied around the family, with many residents volunteering to help with daily tasks and errands, such as grocery shopping and meal preparation, in an effort to alleviate some of the burden during this difficult time. A memorial service is also being planned, with details to be announced in the coming days. Meanwhile, authorities continue to investigate the circumstances surrounding the incident, reviewing security footage and interviewing witnesses to determine exactly what went wrong. As the investigation unfolds, the theme park has suspended operations on the ride in question, pending the outcome of the inquiry.

The park's management has also announced an internal review of their safety protocols, promising to take any necessary steps to prevent such a tragedy from occurring again in the future. In addition, the family of the victim has set up a fundraising page to cover funeral expenses and support their loved one's young children, who are now left without a parent. The outpouring of support has been overwhelming, with donations pouring in from all over the world. As the community comes together to mourn the loss, many are also calling for greater accountability and stricter safety regulations in the amusement park industry as a whole.

In the midst of the tragedy, questions are being raised about the park's history of safety violations and whether they had been adequately addressed. The vigil will be accompanied by a moment of silence, followed by a performance by a local musician who has written a song in tribute to the victim. Furthermore, a local artist will be on site, creating a live mural that reflects the themes of peace, love, and unity. The mural will be auctioned off at the end of the evening, with all proceeds going towards the fund established in the victim's name.
